Columbus says hackers accessed resident's Social Security numbers and bank account details

item.title: No, startups shouldn’t always take the highest valuation, seed VCs say
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
One of the lessons that the wild Silicon Valley venture funding environment of the past few years has clearly taught is this: Bigger valuations are not always better. “I think we’ve all kind of seen the negative impact of having a valuation too high from the last, call it, three years,” Elizabeth Yin, co-founder of […]

item.title: ChatGPT Search is not OpenAI’s ‘Google killer’ yet
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
OpenAI's search offers a glimpse of what an AI-search interface could one day look like. But it's too impractical as a daily driver right now.

item.title: US laws regulating AI prove elusive, but there may be hope
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Can the U.S. meaningfully regulate AI? It’s not at all clear yet. Policymakers have achieved progress in recent months, but they’ve also had setbacks, illustrating the challenging nature of laws imposing guardrails on the technology. In March, Tennessee became the first state to protect voice artists from unauthorized AI cloning. This summer, Colorado adopted a tiered, risk-based […]

item.title: Vanguard cuts Indian ride-share startup Ola’s valuation to $2B
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Vanguard has revised its valuation of Indian ride-hailing startup Ola to about $2 billion as of the end of August.

item.title: Threads now has 275M monthly active users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Meta's social network, Threads, now has 275 million monthly active users, the company said on Sunday.

item.title: X updates block feature, letting blocked users see your public posts
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
X is rolling out its controversial update to the block feature, allowing people to view your public posts even if you have blocked them.

item.title: Affirm launches in the UK as ‘buy now, pay later’ market faces regulatory overhaul
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Buy now, pay later (BNPL) giant Affirm is launching in the U.K., its first market outside North America. Affirm’s long-anticipated arrival comes as U.K. lawmakers mull new rules to bring BNPL firms into line with other traditional consumer credit services, though such laws aren’t expected to come into effect until at least 2026 — long […]

item.description:
Election Day is nearly here, and if you haven’t already mailed in your ballot or gone in for early voting, you might need a ride come November 5.  Here’s a roundup of all the freebies, discounts, and information on getting to the polls that transportation companies are offering. item.title: OpenAI has hired the co-founder of Twitter challenger Pebble
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Gabor Cselle, the former CEO and co-founder of Pebble (a competitor to X), has joined OpenAI to work on a secretive project. Cselle has been employed at OpenAI since October, according to LinkedIn, but he announced the news in a post on X only yesterday. “Will share more about what I’m working on in due […]

item.title: Founders should seek sector alignment when looking for a family office investor
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Family offices invest a substantial amount of capital in startups each year. In the first half of 2023, 27% of overall startup deal value came from deals that included a family office investor, according to a recent report from PwC. Despite their prevalence in startup deals, family offices can be a mysterious class of investors […]

item.title: ‘If you actually are solving a problem, you don’t talk about any of the hype,’ investor says

item.description:
The hype is palpable: As tech folks from near and far converge for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 in San Fransisco — one of the only places where Waymo is available to the public — there’s ample chatter about the autonomous vehicle service. “If you think about AI hype and all, everyone gets excited about what 10 […]

item.title: Wesley Chan on what he looks for as he’s shopping for potential unicorns
item.dc:creator: Matt Rosoff
item.description:
Investor Wesley Chan has shown a knack for making very early investments into multi-billion-dollar unicorns, such as Plaid, Gusto, Flexport, and, most recently, Canva. Chan comes from an unconventional background — he grew up in an immigrant family and had only middling grades in high school. But he landed a job washing test tubes in […]

item.title: Women in AI: Sophia Velastegui believes AI is moving too fast
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
As a part of TechCrunch’s ongoing Women in AI series, which seeks to give AI-focused women academics and others their well-deserved (and overdue) time in the spotlight, TechCrunch interviewed Sophia Velastegui. item.title: GenAI suffers from data overload, so companies should focus on smaller, specific goals
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
“There is no AI without data, there is no AI without unstructured data, and there is no AI without unstructured data at scale,” said Chet Kapoor, chairman and CEO of data management company DataStax. Kapoor was kicking off a conversation at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 about “new data pipelines” in the context of modern AI applications, […]

item.title: Quantum Machines and Nvidia use machine learning to get closer to an error-corrected quantum computer
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
About a year and a half ago, quantum control startup Quantum Machines and Nvidia announced a deep partnership that would bring together Nvidia’s DGX Quantum computing platform and Quantum Machine’s advanced quantum control hardware. We didn’t hear much about the results of this partnership for a while, but it’s now starting to bear fruit and […]

item.title: MIT debuts a large language model-inspired method for teaching robots new skills
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
MIT this week showcased a new model for training robots. Rather than the standard set of focused data used to teach robots new tasks, the method goes big, mimicking the massive troves of information used to train large language models (LLMs). The researchers note that imitation learning — in which the agent learns by following […]

item.title: Can you build a startup without sacrificing your mental health? Bonobos founder Andy Dunn thinks so
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Bonobos founder Andy Dunn is back in the builder’s seat, working on an in-person social media platform called Pie. But the biggest lessons he learned from his $310 million Bonobos exit don’t have as much to do with entrepreneurship as they do with staying sane. item.title: CoffeeSpace is a Hinge-like app that wants to help you find your co-founder
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
CoffeeSpace is on a mission to help people find partners for their startup ideas online. The startup, which exhibited as part of the Startup Battlefield 200 at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, has launched a social networking app that matches people exploring startup ideas and looking for co-founders.  The startup’s algorithm only matches candidates who meet each […]
